page.title: 13Rural Countryside
page.content: The soil is derived mainly from Old Red Sandstone overlain by glacial drift deposits.There is a ridge of terminal moraine parallel to the River Wye and matched by a similar ridge on the S bank. Most soils are deep fertile red marls, with patches of more gravelly strata and some gley soils. The area is mainly agricultural, the deep soils growing heavy crops of corn and grass. Fields are generally small and bounded by hedges, but in recent years some hedges have been grubbed out by farmers for easier working by tractor. The climate is equable and mean annual rainfall is 28ins(5400mm). Winter conditions are usually open but an occasional severe season such as 1982 with deep snowfall and hard frost causes damage to plant and animal life. Pollution is not a problem here.
